result.execSummary:
All charges against Bert C. VanTreese in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bert C. VanTreese is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt: Attorney Joseph L Viney in court.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Viney states he thought DE would be here today but DE has some memory issues so he's not sure why he's not here.  Court questions where this case is headed as the Clerk's Office has addressed the cash bond sitting on the case as yet.  Atty Viney states due to the nature of DE's brain injury and the passage of time since that injury the DE is as good as he's gonna get so the parties are in agreement that this matter can be dismissed.  DE is receiving services from the Juneau Co DHS and meets regulary w/personnel there.  Court questions whether DE is still driving.  Atty Viney states he just got his license back.  State agrees w/statement by Atty Viney and moves to dismiss.  State notes there are no victim issues.  Court agrees w/summary by Atty Viney after reviewing doctor's report and dismisses the matter.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Defendant Bert C. VanTreese in court with attorney Joseph L Viney.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court and parties have recv'd and reviewed report.  State not contesting doctors analysis.  Atty. Viney states DE not able to stand trial.  Court will find DE not competent to stand trial and would not be able to sufficiently assist in trial and will suspend case.

for Appointment of Counsel and Order

State by Sue Mueller.  Defendant appears in person.  Court reviews financial information.  Defendant is not employed.  Does not qualify due to assests.  Finds conditionally indigent.  Court appoints Attorney Joe Viney, 137 3rd Avenue, Baraboo WI  356-2159 @$65/hr @ $25.00/month commencing October 1, 2014 and monthly thereafter.

Defendant Bert C. VanTreese in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received court appointed counsel paperwork, but does not have in hand today.  Court gives rights to an attorney and also PD office information.  State advises defendant was turned down by PD office...does not qualify.  Court gives new court appointed paperwork to defendant to fill out today.  Matter to be recalled.
